nl.sense_os.service.commonsense

Class SensorRegistrator

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.sense_os.service.commonsense.SensorRegistrator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultSensorRegistrator, TrivialSensorRegistrator

    public abstract class SensorRegistrator
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class that registers the sensors for a device at CommonSense.
    Author:
    Steven Mulder

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • checkSensor

        public boolean checkSensor(java.lang.String name,
                  java.lang.String displayName,
                  java.lang.String dataType,
                  java.lang.String description,
                  java.lang.String value,
                  java.lang.String deviceType,
                  java.lang.String deviceUuid)
        Verifies existence of a sensor at CommonSense, adding it to the list of registered sensors if it was newly created.
        Parameters:
        name - Sensor name.
        displayName - Pretty display name for the sensor.
        dataType - Sensor data type.
        description - Sensor description (previously 'device_type')
        value - Dummy sensor value (used for producing a data structure).
        deviceType - Type of device that the sensor belongs to.
        deviceUuid - UUID of the sensor's device.
        Returns:
        true if the sensor ID was found or created

      • getContext

        public android.content.Context getContext()
        Returns:
        The Context

      • verifySensorIds

        public abstract boolean verifySensorIds(java.lang.String deviceType,
                      java.lang.String deviceUuid)
        Verifies that all of the phone's sensors exist at CommonSense, and that the phone knows their sensor IDs.
        Parameters:
        deviceType - The type of device that the sensor is connected to. Use null to connect the sensors to the phone itself.
        deviceUuid - The UUID of the sensor's device. Use null to connect the sensors to the phone itself.
